item.title: Battlefield 4
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

There may be a new CoD every year, but so many people buy each game and make either Infinity Ward or Treyarch and Activision millions. If you were in charge of the CoD series and wen they get released, I’m sure you’d take the opportunity to make the maximum profit.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield 4
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:21, topic:510533”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=628780.msg4272684#msg4272684 date=1364666884]

They don’t release a new BF every year thats pretty much a carbon copy of the last, cod does

I’ll agree on that. I mean cod essentially releases an “update” lol. But my point stands that it’s just another fps.
[/quote]
Well they’re not exactly gonna just change genre completely from the rest of the series[/quote]
BF3: FPS
BF4: Fighting with the sims characters in HD graphics.

item.title: Battlefield 4
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:510533”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=628780.msg4271903#msg4271903 date=1364593970]

As everyone says about the COD series:
“Oh goody, another game with the same shit”

Only it’s completely different. Alright they used the same jeep sounds but apart from that, everything is new, the overall look of the terrain and grassland is completely reworked, explosions look insanely good, animations, destruction looks incredible, taking some of the parts from BF3 and adding onto BC2’s destruction.

It’s a whole new game, if you compare the difference from COD4 and MW3 for example, that’s a good 5 years and I played COD4 last night for 5 hours straight and the difference is minimal.
[/quote]
Everything is completely new in this first person shooter that’s a war game. Yep. Totally.
I think the only game that has really changed itself overtime (Drastically, and not counting graphics, the obvious things that improve due to higher budget more tech) is Halo. Sure, same idea overall. But the story lines are amazing in each game. Even if Halo Reach broke all logic…[/quote]
I for one, agree, Halo is very innovative

Read full topic

As everyone says about the COD series:
“Oh goody, another game with the same shit”
[/quote]

Only it’s completely different. Alright they used the same jeep sounds but apart from that, everything is new, the overall look of the terrain and grassland is completely reworked, explosions look insanely good, animations, destruction looks incredible, taking some of the parts from BF3 and adding onto BC2’s destruction.

It’s a whole new game, if you compare the difference from COD4 and MW3 for example, that’s a good 5 years and I played COD4 last night for 5 hours straight and the difference is minimal.[/quote]
Everything is completely new in this first person shooter that’s a war game. Yep. Totally.
I think the only game that has really changed itself overtime (Drastically, and not counting graphics, the obvious things that improve due to higher budget more tech) is Halo. Sure, same idea overall. But the story lines are amazing in each game. Even if Halo Reach broke all logic…

item.title: Battlefield 4
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:510533”]As everyone says about the COD series:
“Oh goody, another game with the same shit”[/quote]

Only it’s completely different. Alright they used the same jeep sounds but apart from that, everything is new, the overall look of the terrain and grassland is completely reworked, explosions look insanely good, animations, destruction looks incredible, taking some of the parts from BF3 and adding onto BC2’s destruction.

It’s a whole new game, if you compare the difference from COD4 and MW3 for example, that’s a good 5 years and I played COD4 last night for 5 hours straight and the difference is minimal.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield 4
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

No I mean BC2 is the game that put BF on the radar for most COD players, including me.

Then they release BF3 and the maps have become smaller and have tighter spaces (I don’t count flight space) they have an entire dlc dedicated to “close quarters” and they added scope glare. As a whole everything became more fast paced. Its obvious they skewed the game a bit towards the COD playstyle to try and get more players.

It was still an alright game but it felt even more ‘action movie’ than before. Something is always blowing up near you… back to karkand was the best thing they did with BF3.

Read full topic
